headline.main: ??; INTERESTING MISCELLANEOUS INTELLIGENCE. ARRIVAL OF THE ARABIA'S MAILS. THE INSURRECTION IN SPAIN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Arabia arrived at her dock at Boston, from Halifax, at bout 8 o'clock yesterday morning--too late to forward her mails by the early, train. They were sent over the New-Haven Road by the afternoon train, which reached NewYork about midnight.

headline.main: John Mitchel on the Presidential Election.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is an extract of a long letter of Mr. MITCHEL to a friend which has been sent to us for publication. TUCALEECHEE COVE, Tenn., July 15th, 1856. * * * * * * For emigration of Irishmen to America, there are inducements, and there are dissuasives:-the inducements, as I think, by far the stronger.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; About Bonners, and how Mrs. Timberlimb was "Shaved" in hers. Detailing Policemen out of their Districts. Death of an Old Printer.

docs.lead_paragraph: There seems to be a determination on the part of some of our cotemporaries to create a belief in the public mind that the yellow fever has manifested itself among us. But as such is not the case, we do not understand what the motives can be for attempting to spread a misrepresentation on such a subject, when the consequences must be in the highest degree injurious to the interests of the City.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Health met in their customary daily session yesterday at noon. The following vessels were ordered to discharge their cargoes on lighters and proceed to the City: Barke O. Thompson, John Griffin, Robin, Len, Brunette, J. G. Anderson, Lodebar ; brigs Orizimbo, Co. Hon. Coggins; setooner John Castner.

headline.main: Letter of Hecker to the Germans of Buffalo.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is the letter of HECKEFR to Mr. ESSELLEN, editor of the German Telegrarph of this city, about the publication of which in English, tile Demokrat and Courier have had so much anxiety. We have given it the earliest moment after obtaining a translation, and if those journals or any of their friends derive any satisfaction or encouragement from its sentiments or inculcations, we would be the last to interfere with their enjoyments.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Syracuse Journal. A passenger on board the Northern Indiana, gives an account of the narrow escape of CICERO FOWLER and wife, of Tulllly. There was but one life-preserver for Mrs. F. and her husband; he insisted imperatively that she should put it on; she peremptorily refused, saying she was "poor in health, and his life was worth far more thatn hers!"

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; More men from the Crimea. Partnership Suit. Imposition by Express Carriers. Departure of United States Storeships. A Cooling Ice ?? -- The Ice Trade. Commissioners of ??--Free use of ??--No Excuse. John-street Methodist Church--How the Garrison Holds Out.

docs.lead_paragraph: Another company of English laborers from the Crimes came out in the "Orient." and have applied for employment at the office of the American Industrial Associaiton, No. 67 Greenwich street. They are a part of the "Army work corps," the whole numbering at the time of their discharge 3,800 men.
